CatDescriptText: Mr. Eugene Penn, 2174 Elmore Square, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" answer reads: "Yes, especially on the more vicious rackets, like dope, prostitution and the like."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Eugene Penn, wearing flecked coat with three leather buttons, moustache, plaid shirt, and fedora, holding lunch box inscribed "E. P.", standing in front of exterior wall
